quoteFirst: Real as his dream? He wondered.
title: Leda

quoteFirst: “_The letters were brought in at twenty minutes to nine. It was just on
quoteLast: when I left him, the letter still unread. I hesitated with my hand on the door handle, looking back and wondering if there was anything I had left undone._”
title: The murder of Roger Ackroyd
author: Christie, Agatha, 1890-1976

quoteFirst: The number of pupils in the academy was quite large, and, as was customary in those days, they consisted of both sexes, ranging in age from
quoteLast: teen, and even twenty years. There were boys fitting for college, and others pursuing English studies. Some of the older scholars studied surveying, book-keeping, and navigation.
title: The Turning of the Tide; Or, Radcliffe Rich and His Patients
author: Kellogg, Elijah, 1813-1901

quoteFirst: Either you ought to order another or hook it.' He braved it for several more ages, then paid, and went; and still it was only
quoteLast: . All mundane phenomena were inexplicably contorted that night. As he was passing the end of the short street which contains the stage-door of Prince's Theatre, a man, standing at the door on the lookout, hailed him loudly.
title: A Great Man: A Frolic
author: Bennett, Arnold, 1867-1931

quoteFirst: An hour later he left Millstead quite undramatically by the 9.5. The taxi came to the door of Lavery's at
quoteLast: , while the school was in morning chapel; as he rode away and out of the main gates he could hear, faintly above the purr of the motor, the drone of two hundred voices making the responses in the psalms. It did not bring to his heart a single pang or to his eye a single tear.
title: The passionate year
author: Hilton, James, 1900-1954

quoteLast: ! Who'd have believed it? Horses to be groomed before drill, and time up already. I wonder--But here's Nell. She's coming from the kitchen and looks important. What's up, Sis?"

quoteFirst: Cling, clang--creak! Cling, clang--creak! So the discordant bell sounded forth in the playground, the interval between the strokes being filled by a harsh, rusty squeak that set one's teeth on edge. The message it bore to the boys was, "Come in--quick! Come in--quick!" For the time was
quoteLast: , and the day that following the incident which was already known as the Chicken Row.
title: Jack of Both Sides: The Story of a School War
author: Coombe, Florence; Brock, H. M. (Henry Matthew), 1875-1960 [Illustrator]; Pearse, Susan Beatrice, 1878-1980 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: He would wait till ten o'clock. There was another train at ten, but if they missed the
quoteLast: the day would be spoilt, lost. Supposing she did not come, what would he do?--drive back through dingy London and eat a lonely breakfast in that horrible brick Pump Court? He could scarcely do that. Would he go to Reading by himself? The light of the flowing stream, the secrets of the rushes and murmuring woods died; nature became voiceless.
title: Spring Days
author: Moore, George, 1852-1933
